name: Shipwright Quarter
role_in_state: Primary shipbuilding and fleet repair hub
economy_niches: Packaging and staging of imported ritual reagents for sea rites
culture_adjustments: Stricter guild hierarchy and visible insignia
Practical, tool-centered rituals tied to work shifts
Port slang heavily mixed with Island Creole for trade
Apprenticeship status dictates household roles and schooling
Tavern parley and dockside arbitration override formal augury
constraints: limited space for expansion along crowded quays
heavy reliance on imported seasoned timber and reagents
guild charters restrict outside workshop establishment
notes: Supplies specialist ritual reagent-packing for voyage protections
Apprenticeship pipeline supplies state fleet crews and foremen
Buildings reinforced for heavy lifting; narrow lanes hamper wagons
